meta.subject: Science
meta.philosophy: The Upper Primary Science Syllabus aims to provide a national age-appropriate curriculum for learners at Grade 4 to 6, aligning with the Competence-Based Curriculum and 21st Century Skills. It seeks to impart knowledge, skills, values, and positive attitudes necessary for learners to become productive members of their communities and the Zambian society. The syllabus is designed to spark curiosity, nurture foundational skills, and instill a love for learning, recognizing children as natural-born scientists who explore through observation, questioning, and experimentation. It aims to harness these innate abilities to provide a solid foundation for Science Technology Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) education and smooth transition to secondary education.
meta.competence_learning: The syllabus facilitates hands-on experiences through manipulation of real objects, interaction with nature, and learning through research and practical work, enabling learners to develop desirable lifelong skills, values, and positive attitudes. Learning activities are designed to foster curiosity, scientific inquiry, collaborative learning, and sustainable environmental management practices. Activities encourage asking questions, exploring surroundings, making connections between scientific concepts, engaging in age-appropriate experiments to observe cause and effect, explore material properties, and promote teamwork, communication, and sharing of ideas.
goals: Foster curiosity to nurture a sense of wonder by encouraging young learners to ask questions, explore their surroundings, and make connections between the scientific concepts they encounter.

Foster scientific inquiry that promotes a hands-on approach to science by engaging young learners in simple, age-appropriate experiments to observe cause and effect, explore the properties of materials, and develop a keen interest in the world of science.

Encourage collaborative learning by recognising the importance of social interactions in the learning process. The activities should be designed to promote teamwork, communication, and the sharing of ideas, creating a supportive community of learners.
Encourage sustainable environmental management practices to evade the impact of climate change.
